fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45690].
  {panel}

All my JIRA projects use Kanban boards as a primary user interface for all users. I see no use cases where I would want to set up JIRA without Kanban boards. The Kanban method and Kanban boards are just as useful for business projects as for software development projects. Kanban boards for business projects should preferably be free from any software jargon and hard-coded software-specific behavior. With the announcement of JIRA 7 Software, it seems that JIRA Agile boards may become even more software-specific in future releases.

Having to go for the full JIRA Software license just to get Kanban boards available in business projects is far from ideal. Higher cost is just one reason. Added complexity for users from seeing irrelevant software features and terminology is more important.

Along with many others, I have previously requested more flexible configuration options for JIRA Agile boards, in particular more dynamic filters.

Please consider adding a generic, flexible Kanban board as part of JIRA Core, or at least as an add-on.
fields.summary: Add a generic Kanban board to JIRA Core

The gadget should show the percentages of each issue type.

Only the first result is displayed correctly. All other results are displayed as 0%.

h2. Summary

JIRA fails to register the comment that is being added through the _Assign_ screen even though the current user has the *Add Comment* permission. 

h2. Environment
JIRA Cloud 1000.1169.1

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project
# Configure the permission scheme:
#* Assign *Add Comment* permission only to *Current Assignee* and *Administrator* 
# Create a ticket and assign it to the current user (ensure the current user is in the Administrators group)
# Click on *Assign* button in the Issue View Screen of the ticket
# Assign to user A (ensure that user A does not have the administrator rights in this project) and add a comment on the same screen

h2. Expected Result
The issue is reassigned and comment is added to ticket

h2. Actual Result
The issue is reassigned but the comment is not added to the ticket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using JIRA Cloud Search API with pagination on a JIRA "Service Desk" Project , reporter field is missing for all the issues returned by the search if at least one of those issues has the reporter set to anonymous.

h3. Environment
Vertigo JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Query JIRA Service Desk project issue from issue navigator. Check total of issue in that project. For example 5 issues.
# Set the reporter to Anonymous to one of the issues (e.g. the 5th issue, IT-5)
# Use rest api to search the issues for that project:
{noformat}
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?startAt=0&maxResults=3&jql=project=IT
{noformat}
# See that the reporter field displayed in the REST response
# Now, include all the results in the search by running:
{noformat}
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?startAt=0&maxResults=5&jql=project=IT
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Reporter field should be returned for all the issues (showing 'anonymous' for IT-5)

h3. Actual Results
Reporter field is not returned for any of the issues. Also, calling the below endpoint does not return the reporter field:
{noformat}
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/IT-5
{noformat}
 
The below error is found in the logs:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder2	Cannot get value from RestAwareField reporter, exception: 'userKeys[0] should not be null!' 
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This only happens for JIRA Service Desk issues since you are not allowed not to enter a reporter for JIRA Core and Software issues.

h3.Workaround
Create a dummy user to set as the reporter instead of 'anonymous'
fields.summary: The reporter field is not returned for /rest/api/2/search with pagination and /rest/api/2/issue when the reporter is set to anonymous

fields.description:
Following documentation to do the OAuth dance:
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/

There is a step where you request for authorization token.
If you send two separate requests and receive two callbacks, it is not possible to map request to callback.

*Use case scenario:*

I am creating a stateless API (which in turns interacts with other clients) to work with Jira API using three-legged Oauth flow.
The first two steps were successful as described in the link: https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-oauth-authentication and I receive the verification token on my callback url.
However, since i'm developing a stateless application, it gets really hard for me to determine the User for whom I received the token for. Eg. if two users simultaneously authorize with jira and I receive two callback over the callback url, how would i know about the user <--->mapping ?
fields.summary: Add callback identifier (parameter) for token request call
Releasing a version shows the Release Date one day behind the date originally set

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for JIRA Issues using the {{text}} JQL field, the search can time out and render an error message "Error occurred communicating with the server.Please reload the page and try again." 

This can also happen in Basic Mode when inputting a search term in the "Contains text" box.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Issues > Search for issues
 # Go to Advanced mode and try to search using {{text ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM}}

h3. Expected Results
 * Search results are (almost)instantly returned

h3. Actual Results
 * You receive an error message in the UI "Error occurred communicating with the server.Please reload the page and try again." 

 !Screen Shot 2017-08-10 at 6.18.10 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 ** Instead use any other available fields to return the desired results. For a list of available fields, please see: [Advanced searching fields reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-DescriptionDescription]
 ** For example: use {{summary ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM OR description ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM}}.

h3. Note

If you are using the quick search (top right corner text box) and your searches are not loaded i.e the page doesn't load any results, only a blank page, you are possibly struck by this bug.
fields.summary: Using a JQL text search sometimes can render an error msg Error occurred communicating with the server.Please reload the page and try again.

fields.description:
Hi Team 

It will be great if we get a *Bar Chart gadget* that will be *same as the Pie Chart gadget*. The reason of this suggestion is that, a dashboard will look more attractive if we can combine a percentage type grapgh(Pie Chart) along with the count in a Bar Chart format in our dashboards.

All the parameters of this suggested Bar Chart gadget should be same as the Pie Chart gadget, only the chart will be in bar format instead of Pie chart format. Pie charts are very useful when there are lots of types of data, but for less type of data the pie chart looks like a dull circle with three or four colors. Therefore, having one bar chart with same parameters and colorfulness of the pie chart will be great to use when there are less type of data.
fields.summary: Introduce a Bar Chart gadget with same parameters of Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 *Atlassian Update, May 24th, 2019:*

Hello Henry,

We tried but could not reproduce this issue. By design, duplicate release name is not allowed in Jira cloud. Please let us know if you still face this issue or share relevant details.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management team

{panel}

I was somehow able to create duplicate versions for one of my JIRA projects. 

Now everywhere on the interface, it lists the same version twice.

In Project Settings->Versions, I see both, but one has bugs assigned to it, and another does not. However if I delete the one that has no bugs assigned, it gives me the option to assign a bug to another version. I suspect if I delete the version via this interface, both will be deleted.

 

I beleive I created it by somehow having a JIRA Create Bug page open, creating the version via project settings in another browser tab. and then typing in the same version in the free form field of "Affects Versions" and attempting to create the bug. Prior to me creating the version in another tab, I had tried to submit the bug report, and got the error that the version was not found. 

 

Note, I have JIRA Admin priviledges.
fields.summary: able to create duplicate versions in project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Granting *Current Assignee* to the *Administer Project* permissions will allow users to see *ALL* Projects that are assigned to that Permission Scheme. You can see the projects even if the user does not have any assigned issues in the project or even if the user is not listed as site-admin. This is a security issue since it will allow users access to view Project Setting as well as Edit some Project fields
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud: 1000.1162.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Isolate test user to only have JIRA application access on instance and no other Project Permissions:
 # Create sample user. (You can use any user that does not have any issue created or assigned)
 # Creating new group: test-group
 # Add group to user
 # Removing all other groups from user so that the only group is test-group
 # Add JIRA Application Access to group-test: https://<example>.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig (just can sign in, no admin permission)
 # Login in as user
 # Cog Wheel is *NOT* be present in top right for JIRA Administration> This is good news and is intended
 # User Browse Project page: https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all > Should only see the project they have access too. In this test, only project using *Any Logged in User* permission. This is right
 # Paste the Admin Project Page (Page which the example user cannot navigate to via the UI) > https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
 # Cannot see a list of project, this is good and right > error:
{code:java}
You do not have the permissions to administer any projects, or there are none created.
{code}

+Create Bug+: Add *Current Assignee* to the *Administer Project* permissions for a Test Permission scheme
 # Adding *Current Assignee* to *Administer project* permission for sample Permission Scheme
 # Make sure Permission scheme has attached a few Projects
 # Log in as test user
 # Now you can see the cog wheel top right to Administer JIRA. Only selection in drop down is *Projects*
 # Clicking Project will take you to the Project Admin page > https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
 # You can see *All* projects that have the test permission scheme attached. Even if the user never had access to view these project or if they are not a site-admin. Users also can make changes to certain fields

h3. Expected Results
 * For users to only be able Administer Project which they have Assigned tickets
 * For user to only be able to view and access project that they have Assigned tickets

h3. Actual Results
 - End users are able to view ALL Projects attached to the permission scheme with Current Assignee listed for Administer Project permission
 - User is also able to make changes to these project :(
 - The list of Projects attached to Permission scheme are visible by all users, including non-admins. Even if user does not have any issues assigned to them in the project

h3. Notes

Related bugs:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31720
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37117

Feature request:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37057

h3. Workaround

Remove *Current Assignee* from the *Administer Project* permissions for all permission schemes

Query to narrow down the Permission Schemes affected:
{code:java}
SELECT SP.perm_type AS Role, SP.perm_parameter AS GroupName, PS.name AS PermissionSchemeName, SP.permission_key AS Permission
FROM schemepermissions SP 
INNER JOIN permissionscheme PS ON SP.scheme = PS.id
WHERE SP.permission_key = 'ADMINISTER_PROJECTS' 
AND SP.perm_type = 'assignee';
{code}
fields.summary: Granting Current Assignee to the Administer Project permissions will allow user to view all Projects

fields.description:
As mentioned by the product manager Dave Meyer on [JRACLOUD-30620|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30620], the purpose of having a default issue type is only for the very first time you click on the "Create" button, during a login session.

Once a user has created an issue in a project in the current session, JIRA retains the issue type from the previous issue any time the user creates a new issue in the same project, ignoring the Default Issue type set.

Would be great if the functionality of the Default Issue Type feature could be applicable even after the first ticket creation on a Project.
fields.summary: Improve Default Issue Type usability

fields.description:
Please restore the Users and Roles previously found in Project Properties. The new People 'feature' is not optimal and complicates the process of project/user management.

Previously, all users were listed by Role and it was easy to determine whether the user was appropriately configured for the project. Now, users with multiple roles display a drop-down menu, making it impossible to see which users are assigned to roles. Clicking on the dropdown presents only the selected user's roles - it does not display all of the roles for all of the users.

Another suggestion would be to ask JIRA admins to evaluate proposed changes before implementing them.
fields.summary: Users and Roles - changes

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Changing project lead in the *Details* page is not working. This occurs only in JIRA with a new UI design. 

h2. Environment
JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Go to JIRA with a new UI design 
# Create a new project
# Go to *Details* page
# Change project lead

h2. Expected Result
Changing project lead should work properly

h2. Actual Result
Changing project lead is not working with below error:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to change project lead

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to know who viewed or downloaded an attachment in the issues.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to have a log to track which users view and download attachment
fields.summary: Logs to track who viewed and downloaded attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User wants more options to be able to sort the attachment in an issue and also a global configuration as well that can apply to all the attachments in the instance, set to a particular default sorting option.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)


h3. Expected Results

To be able to sort attachments with the following option: File Type, Size, Last Opened Time.
h3. Actual Results

The attachment is only sorted in descending and ascending order for name of attachment and date of attachment.
fields.summary: Additional sorting attachment options (Size, Last Opened Time, File Type)

fields.description:
Currently, only 'site-admins' group grants access to the 'user management' of a Cloud instance.

Allow a way to designate other groups with 'user management' permission.
fields.summary: Ability for adding other groups granting access to 'user management'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Due Date is displayed as one day earlier on the email notification on certain instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one ticket setting the due date.
# Take a look on the email sent as notification.

h3. Expected Results
The received email has some info, like for example the Issue type, Assignee, Created Date and Due date. The Due Date should be the same specified on the ticket creation. For example, if the Due Date was set to 8/Aug, this date should be depicted on the email.

h3. Actual Results
On the email, the Due Date is showing as one day earlier. See the images below:
- Due Date on the email notification:
 !due-email.png|thumbnail! 

 - The same Due Date when you view the issue:
 !due-issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: The Due Date is incorrectly displayed on the email notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a JQL filter with the resolutiondate field and an OR statement, JIRA does not retrieve the correct results.

Example: "resolutiondate = EMPTY OR resolutiondate >= endOfDay(-2)"

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample software project in the instance
 # Navigate to Issues > Search for issues
 # Enter _*resolutiondate = EMPTY*_ as the JQL
 # Note the amount of results
 # Enter _*resolutiondate >= endOfDay(-2)*_ as the JQL
 # Note the amount of results
 # Enter _*resolutiondate = EMPTY OR resolutiondate >= endOfDay(-2)*_ as the JQL

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should show issues from both statements
h3. Actual Results

JIRA only shows the issues from the _*resolutiondate >= endOfDay(-2)*_ part of the JQL query.
fields.summary: OR statement in JQL with resolutiondate field shows incorrect results.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Unable to add/remove linked issues

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to add/remove issues from issue links as in browser version.

h3. Why this is important
JIRA App should have the same features as the browser version, so we can use it on portable devices.
fields.summary: Issue Linking for JIRA App on iOS Version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Labs features are enabled for all users and can be disabled in the User Profile page.  

{quote}
*Labs*
Labs features let us experiment with new ideas and get real-world feedback to improve on them. They are works in progress, so they can change or break, or may not end up released at all.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution

Add possibility to disable the JIRA Labs features for all users on the instance and not per user profile
fields.summary: Add possibility to disable/enable the JIRA Labs features for all users on the instance and not per user profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to select a custom [JQL filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html] to create specific notifications to be send from JIRA to Slack channels when using the *Slack for JIRA* system add-on.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The goal is to have the possibility to select a custom JQL filter to narrow down specific events that will send notifications to Slack.

h3. Actual Results
Currently, the following events are available:
* Issue created
* Assignee updated
* Someone leaves a comment
* Issue transitioned to a specific *status*
fields.summary: Support to filter JIRA notifications sent to Slack channels using a JQL Filter
Releasing a version shows the Release Date one day behind the date originally set in Cloud latest infrastructure

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
JIRA CSV import provides the log information if the import fails. However, the log does not explain in details on the root cause. For an example, below error is showing in the log report:
{code}2017-08-01 12:51:41,857 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='autoid-7931768510384360143', summary='CSV import']
2017-08-01 12:51:41,936 ERROR - Error importing issue [externalId='autoid-7931768510384360143', summary='CSV import']{code}
But the import actually fails due to mismatch values in the CSV file (e.g: the Status field contains a value that does not exist in the respective JIRA project)

h2. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful to the users if JIRA could provide more detailed log report on what is causing the import failure. This could help giving the customer a hint on where the issue lies on too.
fields.summary: Improve CSV import error message

fields.description:

User has noticed a number of corrections to be made on the Project Creation button and content mostly regarding to the German language Deutsch (Deutschland) translation of the JIRA description. User also noticed some content which was not translated to German language as well.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)

 # Go to View All Project > Hover on the Create Project button > You will see the word "null" in English appear
 # Click on the Create Project Button > Choose a Project Type > Click on Create > On the next page hover on the Tool-tip
 # "Project Schlüssel" is wrong, it should be "Projektschlüssel", "Schlüssel des Projekts", or "Projekt-Schlüssel"(in descending order of recommendation)

To be able to read the correct translation of the JIRA description in the German language.

Grammatical errors and failure to translate the content into the German Language

Step 1:

  !german01.png|width=680,height=41!

Step 3 to Step 4 :

!german02.png|width=522,height=209!
fields.summary: German Language Translation of Some Description is Incorrect
Import fail - Error adding user to group jira-users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Issue change logs don't contain the fieldId of the field that was changed, but simply the field's translated name in the locale of the user who edited the issue. 

This makes it incredibly hard for us to implement a field value changed trigger where we want to check if a specific field changed. Depending on the locale of the user who triggered the event and the (potentially differing locale) of the user that configured the field value changed trigger the field names may be translated differently.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ideally the changelog would contain the field id (e.g. 'customfield_123453' or 'summary') in both cloud and server. I understand that these ids can change over time (in the case of custom fields), so you don't have to store them in the db with an issue's change log entries, but it would still be *very* useful information for us to pass them along in the event/webhook.
fields.summary: fieldid should be used for all fields in activity (change history) of the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Task description column is being clipped off from screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Chrome, set the screen resolution to 4500 x 3000 and view the backlog list in any Boards.

h3. Expected Results
View the content with no clipping

h3. Actual Results
Most left content will be clipped
fields.summary: Screen Clipping at Backlog with Chrome at Full Screen when Resolution: 4500 x 3000 is being used

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom Field name in the activity (change history) of the issue will be always taken from the name of the custom field.
As a result, translation in the activity (change history) section does not work.

Use case:
If user who uses Russian locale created a custom field and named it in Russian, user who uses English locale will always see this custom field in Russian in the activity (change history) section of the issue. Even if there is an existing translation for this custom field.
However, this custom field is translated properly in the issue details. 

h3. Environment
1000.1155.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create custom field and name it 'Locale-Test'
# Add translation for this custom field for Russian language: 'Locale-Russian'
# Add this custom field to the project and create an issue
# Change value of the custom field (to make sure we have change history)
# Switch user to Russian locale

h3. Expected Results

Custom field in details of the issue is named 'Locale-Russian'
Custom field in activity section is named 'Locale-Russian'

h3. Actual Results

Custom field in details of the issue is named 'Locale-Russian'
Custom field in activity section is named 'Locale-Test'

 !English-Russian_locale.PNG|thumbnail!  !Russian-English_locale.PNG|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Custom Fields are not translated in activity (change history) of the issue

fields.description:
User story:

An issue is handed back and forth for a few weeks, it goes through multiple revision loops which include uploaded screen grabs, word documents, etc.  Eventually the list of attachments becomes unmanageable and worthless.

Wishful thinking:

We should be able to group the attachments together, be it by folders, or tags, or something. For example in my above user story if the attachments that have been acted upon can be in a subfolder named completed, or tagged as completed, etc. Then we could either pick a folder with just those attachments, or use some kind of fiter to just look at one tag.
fields.summary: Allow some visual/logical management for lists of attachments in issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As per [How to migrate projects from one JIRA Cloud application to another|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-migrate-projects-from-one-jira-cloud-application-to-another-779160766.html], customer performed a full backup, then manually deleted the any unwanted data from the target instance. However, we can still find the workflow data on the *entities.xml*.

h3. Environment *
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some workflows on the instance
# Attempt to delete them
# Export the instance via *Backup Manager*
# Check the data of deleted workflows on *entities.xml*

h3. Expected Results
No data found about the deleted workflow

h3. Actual Results
There are retained data on {{OSPropertyString}} & {{OSWorkflowEntry}}.
Checked the database, we can see the retained data on {{propertystring}} & {{os_wfentry}} tables.
fields.summary: Deleting the Workflow Does not Delete All Data

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for JIRA Issues using the {{text}} JQL field, the search can be slow. JIRA appears to have done nothing after executing the search, but after some time the search results are returned. This only applies when searching using the {{text}} clause. The issue doesn't appear when searching by field e.g. {{summary}} or {{description}}.

This can also happen in Basic Mode, when inputting a search term in the "Contains text" box.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Issues > Search for issues
 # Go to Advanced mode and try to search using {{text ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM}}

h3. Expected Results
 * Search results are (almost)instantly returned

h3. Actual Results
 * JIRA appears to do nothing, search results are returned after some time

h3. Workaround
 * Avoid using the {{text}} field in this Advanced mode when searching for issues,
 ** Instead use any other available fields to return the desired results. For a list of available fields, please see: [Advanced searching fields reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-DescriptionDescription]
 ** For example: use {{summary ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM OR description ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM}}.
fields.summary: Searching for issues is slow when using the "text" JQL field

fields.description:
When accessing the Audit Logs for Add-ons, changes made by System are shown as made by *anonymous* user, as shown on picture below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-02 at 3.08.38 PM.png|thumbnail!

This information should be more clear/specific, as for now showing anonymous is not helpful at all. To access these logs, go to *JIRA Administration > Add-ons*, navigate to *Manage Add-ons* and click *Audit Logs*.
h3. Additional information.

(i) When apps are installed *by a user* visiting the Mange-apps page on a Jira instance, then the user information is recorded correctly on the UI. However, when an app is installed *from the backend* by the system because a purchase order for the app was submitted, then the user information is not shown correctly on the UI and appears as 'anonymous'.
fields.summary: Show user responsible for action on Add-on Audit Log

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a bulk operation the rate of updated issues is 15 seconds to 30 seconds per issue

h3. Customer Impact
Modifying hundreds of issues can take hours to complete.
Users depend on bulk updates for regular modification of issues.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a JIRA search
# Select the option to Bulk modify
# Complete the steps to edit a field
# Confirm process

h3. Expected Results
Bulk update runs in a few seconds/minutes

h3. Actual Results
a rate of 15 to 30 seconds per issue is found

h3. Notes
This behaviour was presented after [JRACLOUD-67286|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67286]

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the time
fields.summary: Bulk operations are slow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to import Bitbucket issues via JSON importer
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export issues from Bitbucket repository using the steps outlined on this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/export-or-import-issue-data-330797432.html]
 # Try to import JSON file by selecting the JSON option in the JIRA Import Wizard - External System Import

h3. Expected Results

Issues are created in JIRA
h3. Workaround

At this current point in time the below workarounds are not working anymore:
{quote} # A simple JSON to CSV converter does not work. You have to re-format the data using something like the [https://bitbucket.org/Enharmonic/bitbucket-to-jira-issue-conversion] tool (that is outdated and not supported).
 # Download and install a test JIRA Server (latest version) locally. Use the native BB importer to import the issues in there. Follow the steps in below KB to merge the 2 instances together (since you only have 1 Cloud instance you can skip step #1 of the KB):
 -- [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-merge-two-different-jira-cloud-applications-together-779160767.html]{quote}
Point #2 is not working at the moment due to another open bug introduced in Jira Server 7.13: JRASERVER-69595 

Therefore, what can be done while waiting for the above bug to be fixed is the following:
 # Install a staging Jira Server using the [latest 7.12 release available for download (7.12.3)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-12-x-release-notes-955179462.html]
 # Use external system import to import the issues from Bitbucket Cloud into Jira Server
 # Once the issue are imported, depending on your needs, you can either:
 -- Export the issues to CSV and import them in Jira Cloud. See [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html] and [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-765593817.html] for details.
 -- Upgrade Jira to latest 7.13 version then use the [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://www.atlassian.com/cloud-migration/jcma] to import the issues in Cloud (Still EAP. Only available to customers that ask for it at the moment. For details see: [About the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant early access program|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Migrations-Early-Access/About-the-Jira-Cloud-Migration-Assistant-early-access-program/gpm-p/1165638]
 -- Upgrade to a more recent Jira version (or latest) and follow the steps in the KB [Merge multiple instances of Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/merge-multiple-instances-of-jira-cloud-779160767.html] as explained in previous workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to Import Bitbucket Issues into JIRA in JSON

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Check Activity of the issue.
Date and time will differ if you check specific transition in _History_ tab and in _Transitions_ tab.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create an issue.
 #  Wait for 1 minute and make a transition of the issue.
 # Check _Activity_ section of the issue and choose _History_ tab, compare it with _Transitions_ tab.

h3. Expected Results

Date and time of _Transition_ tab should match with _History_ tab.

h3. Actual Results

Date and time is shown correctly in _History_ tab.
 Date and time of a transition in _Transitions_ tab is taken from the previous activity, which is creation date.

 !Transitions_time_mismatch.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inconsistency of date and time between History tab and Transitions tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the menu "People", while typing the user name (or email) of some users, the search don't find any information. When all username (or email) is typed, the user is found


Steps to Reproduce

# Open a project settings;
# Access menu people;
# Click on "Add people";
# Type an information of some user (username or email)


h3. Expected Results

During the typing, the search should update with information found

h3. Actual Results

None information is found during the typing, just when all information is typed, the information is found.

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround

Type all user information to add to a role.
fields.summary: Search of People menu doesn't work while typing

fields.description: When troubleshooting a ticket for an issue on the date picker to start a Sprint, I found nothing public about date format configurations for the JIRA Cloud or anything recent for JIRA Server, the issue was caused by a misconfiguration by the JIRA administrator.
fields.summary: Create documentation for Date Format configurations for JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
I am requesting the ability to add/delete groups to roles for all projects at one time (or maybe a group of projects selected).  

It would be helpful (and much faster) if I could globally manage adding and removing groups to project roles.  I don't necessarily want all of the project role groups to be the same across projects, but there are times when adding or removing to all/globally is needed. 

Just in case, I am not referring to the Permission Scheme.

Regards.

fields.description:
[This page should be updated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-bitbucket-803604051.html] to clarify that the Bitbucket importer is no longer supported and that users need to use the JSON importer instead. It should also describe the changes necessary in order to make sure the file is imported into JIRA successfully:

1. The Bitbucket "issues" attribute, i.e.
{code:java}
"issues": [
	    {
	      "status": "new",
	      "priority": "major",
	      "kind": "bug",
	      "content_updated_on": null,
	      "voters": [],
	      "title": "A title for the issue",
	      "reporter": "dmeyer",
	      "component": null,
	      "watchers": [
	        "dmeyer"
	      ],
	      "content": "A description of the issue",
	      "assignee": null,
	      "created_on": "2017-08-01T20:24:43.481898+00:00",
	      "version": null,
	      "edited_on": null,
	      "milestone": null,
	      "updated_on": "2017-08-01T20:24:43.481898+00:00",
	      "id": 2
	    }
	   ]
{code}
This needs to be wrapped inside of a {{"project"}} object in order for JIRA to successfully create project. So the above example needs to look something like this:
{code:java}
"projects": [
        {
            "name": "A Sample Project",
            "key": "ASM",
            "description": "A description of the project",
            "type": "software",
            "template":"com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-scrum-template",
		  "issues": [
		    {
		      "status": "To Do",
		      "priority": "major",
		      "kind": "bug",
		      "content_updated_on": null,
		      "voters": [],
		      "title": "My first issue!",
		      "reporter": "dmeyer",
		      "component": null,
		      "watchers": [
		        "dmeyer"
		      ],
		      "summary": "issue from bitbucket",
		      "assignee": "dmeyer",
		      "created_on": "2016-11-03T06:31:17.395256+00:00",
		      "version": null,
		      "edited_on": null,
		      "milestone": null,
		      "updated_on": "2016-11-03T06:31:17.395256+00:00",
		      "id": 1
		    }
		   ]
		}
  ]
{code}
 

2. The project object, in addition to a name, key and description, requires a {{"type"}} field that can be "business", "software", or "service-desk", and a {{"template"}} field that should be supplied if "software" is selected. For a SCRUM project the template should be "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-scrum-template" and for a KANBAN project the template should be "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-kanban-template". The full list of templates available can be obtained from this private API {{[https://{{yourjirasite}}.atlassan.net/rest/project-templates/1.0/templates|https://yourjirastie.atlassan.net/rest/project-templates/1.0/templates]}}.

3. Several fields need to be renamed in order to be mapped correctly to JIRA fields. A full list is already on the documentation page but this needs to be done manually in the JSON file and won't be handled in a wizard. Specifically:
||In Bitbucket Export||Rename to import to JIRA||
|title|summary|
|kind|issuetype|
|content|description|

4. You must verify that the statuses and issue types that your Bitbucket issues will map to have already been created in JIRA.
fields.summary: Update the "Importing issues from Bitbucket" documentation to describe how to use the JSON importer

fields.description:
Summary
It is cumbersome for users with multiple accounts/organizations to switch between them since this requires logging out from one account and logging it to another account. This is in contrast to how things used to be before this system was overhauled back in May. Before that, it was possible to keep multiple accounts active in different tabs of the same browser.

Suggestion
1. Restore the status quo - preferred option. Perhaps, make it an option to trade security for convenience.

2. Make it less awkward to switch between accounts (without full log out and log in). For example, make it similar to how we can change projects within the same organization.
fields.summary: Users with multiple accounts/organizations to switch between

h3. Summary

When importing the backup from another Cloud instance, it shows following error:
 !Screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a backup from another Cloud instance
 # Attempt to import the backup on a new instance

h3. Expected Results

Import is done successfully
h3. Actual Results

Error promted:
{quote}JIRA is locked for import but no import could be found. This is likely to be a temporary issue and should clear up within one minute. If you continue to see this error, please contact support.
{quote}
JIRA logs:
{noformat}
cloud.atlassian.provisioning.exception.PermanentProvisioningFailureException: Import task failed: [Error occurred while running the task. Please contact support.]
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.CloudBackupManager.startImport(CloudBackupManager.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.lambda$importArchive$1(ImportResource.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.lambda$withTenantedWorkContext$0(AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.java:68)

	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.withTenantedWorkContext(AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.importArchive(ImportResource.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.lambda$post$0(ImportResource.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AsyncCloudTaskRunner$AsyncCloudProvisionerHelper.wrapTask(AsyncCloudTaskRunner.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AsyncCloudTaskRunner$AsyncCloudProvisionerHelper.lambda$runAsync$0(AsyncCloudTaskRunner.java:129)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.exec(CompletableFuture.java:1582)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:289)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.runTask(ForkJoinPool.java:1056)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1692)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:157)
{noformat}
{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: requestGroupAccessToProduct failed
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.withRetry(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.requestGroupAccessToProduct(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.updatePermission(IdentityImportHelper.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.updateGroupPermissions(IdentityImportHelper.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:298)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$2(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:152)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:41)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.exec(CompletableFuture.java:1582)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:289)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.runTask(ForkJoinPool.java:1056)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1692)
	at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:157)
Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.ServerException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"500","detail":"An unknown error occurred","errorType":"UnknownError","message":"An unknown error occurred"}
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeException(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:579)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeExceptionIgnoringResult(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:526)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.makeRequestWithEntityBodyAndNoExpectedResponse(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:514)

{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * This only happens if the source instance contains 'confluence-administrators' group

h3. Workaround

It is caused by duplicate entries on Global Permissions for 'confluence-administrators' group. Remove one of them from *entities.xml*.
Example:
{code:java}
    <GlobalPermissionEntry id="10104" permission="SYSTEM_ADMIN" group_id="confluence-administrators"/>
    <GlobalPermissionEntry id="10121" permission="SYSTEM_ADMIN" group_id="confluence-administrators"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Import Fails Due to "Group <confluence-administrators> does not exist"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Default security level is not applied for new issues if they are created with the button {{Create linked issue}}

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project 
# Add a security scheme and set a default level
# Add security field to the issue creation screen of the project created on step 1
# On a Service Desk request, click on {{...}} > {{Create linked issue}} > select the project created on step 1 > create the issue

h3. Expected Results
The default security level is added to the new issue

h3. Actual Results
No security is added to the new issue
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Remove the security field from issue creation screen
fields.summary: Default security level is not applied for new issues

fields.description:
*Summary*

For JIRA Cloud, it is currently not possible to disable the issue history tab as oriented in [How to hide the "History" tab in the issue panel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-hide-the-history-tab-in-the-issue-panel-702710334.html/].

Instead of the disable button you will see *Module cannot be modified*.

It would be great to have a feature to disable the history tab.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Login as an Administrator to your JIRA instance
# Navigate to System > Add-ons > in the left menu Manage add-ons
# In the central drop-down list (which default option is User-installed) choose the System option
# Click on the add-on Issue Tab Panels Plugin to expand.
# Click in modules link to expand.
# Instead of the button disable you will see *Module cannot be modified*.
fields.summary: Add the option to disable the history tab.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Workflows that have 'Code Committed' FishEye condition in place will break due to them being removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try to transition an issue which uses a workflow with 'Code Committed' FishEye condition.
h3. Expected Results

As per the following documentation, workflow transitions should work when there are FishEye conditions in the workflow:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/fisheye-and-crucible-workflow-conditions-and-gadgets-will-be-removed-from-jira-cloud-on-24-july-2017-915148525.html]

h3. Actual Results

Workflow transitions don't show in the issue view. The following error appears in the logs:

"message: Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.domain.workflow.condition.CodeCommittedCondition':"


h3. Workaround

Remove the condition.
fields.summary: Workflows that have 'Code Committed' FishEye condition in place will break

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no native support on Chromecast for the [Wallboard feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/displaying-a-dashboard-as-a-wallboard-720416968.html].

For the time being, users must display the wallboard in a browser and cast that, but this isn't ideal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to cast to a Chromecast directly from the wallboard without needing a browser tab.

h3. Why this is important?
A nice life improvement would be first-class Chromecast functionality for Wallboards (browser based JIRA Cloud)

Workaround, of course, is Chromecasting the tab.

(Moving your mouse to another monitor, going full screen, Ctrl-Tabbing to another tab, un-fullscreen so the Chromecast takes the full 16:9 resolution...)
 
h3. Workaround 
Cast the browser tab instead.
fields.summary: Native Support for Wallboard on Chromecast

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer comment:
{quote}
Using also about 5 person profiles with
having > 10 Windows open with more then 10 Tabs.
Using capture concurrently in several windows may cause the problem (also
having different chrome people using it).
When I take care about only using it in one session, it works as usual.
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
1.) open chrome in two windows
2.) open additional incognito window
3.) capture from incognito window. Capture will be opened in one of the two
non-incognito windows
4.) do not create the issue in capture, but leave it open.
5.) try to add screenshot from the other non-incognito window. New capture
will be opened in this window. Now you have two capture instances open.
6.) try to save „create issue“ from the first capture instance.
7.) capture will stuck in „Creating issue“ screen forever.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve JIRA Capture performance
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Capture performance

h2. Steps to Replicate

Currently, it is stuck in progress.

|10054|10000|Transitioning 3 issues| |ENQUEUED|0|2017-07-28T14:11:28.128Z| | |2017-07-28T14:11:28.128Z| |N|com.atlassian.jira.bulkedit.BulkEditTaskRunner:BulkWorkflowTransition:557058:96530d15-eb54-4ca0-aaf0-8aa9a478df94|

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the ScriptRunner add-on, we can create scripts to download attachments from issues. In this case, it will use the following link to get the file:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/<attachment_id>/<filename>
{code}

This works if run using the current user. However, if we configure the script to run that as the {{addon_com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner}} user, it fails with a 401 Unauthorized error. Even if the user has full access to the project and issues.

We can see that even in script that first run a JQL via REST which works. So the add-on user has permission to run JQL via REST, it's just getting the attachments that fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a script, say in a postfunction, using ScriptRunner to get attachment from an issue using a link like this:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/<attachment_id>/<filename>
{code}
# First, select to run as current user
# Run it
# Then, change it to run as ScriptRunner user
# Run it again

h3. Expected Results
Both times, the script is able to download the attachment.

h3. Actual Results
It works when run as current user (provided the user has access to the issue), but it fails with the add-on user with this error:
{noformat}
2017-07-27 20:42:02.450 WARN - GET request to https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/<id>/<attachment> returned an error code: status: 401 - Unauthorized
body: 

<html>

<!--[if IE]><![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript" >

    var DeferScripts = { deferState: 'disabled' };
</script>
<script>
window.WRM=window.WRM||{};window.WRM._unparsedData=window.WRM._unparsedData||{};window.WRM._unparsedErrors=window.WRM._unparsedErrors||{};
WRM._unparsedData["com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-plugins-webresource-plugin:context-path.context-path"]="\"\"";
WRM._unparsedData["com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-plugins-webresource-rest:curl.cross-origin-resources"]="false";
WRM._unparsedData["jira.webresources:feature-flags.feature-flag-data"]="{\"enabled-feature-keys\":[\"com.atlassian.rm.portfolio.vertigo.AMQ\",\"com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.boardtoprojectcache.enabled\",\"ka.FLUSH_HEAD_EARLY\",\"sd.new.settings.sidebar.location\",\"jira.frother.reporter.field\",\"jira.plugin.devstatus.phasetwo\",\"statusSearchRenderer.enableFastWorkflowStatusQuery\",\"atlassian.rest.xsrf.legacy.enabled\",\"jira.attachment.vertigo.MEDIA_API_READ\",\"dvcs.connector.smartcommits.disabled\",\"com.atlassian.jira.plugins.one-click-invite-enabled\",\"jira.issue.status.lozenge\",\"unified.usermanagement\",\"jira.project.config.new.version.menu\",\"com.atlassian.jira.projects.issuenavigator\",\"com.atlassian.growth.experiments.aesJavaClient\",\"jira.plugin.devstatus.phasetwo.enabled\",\"jira.project.config.old.components.screen.disabled\",\"com.atlassian.jira.config.CoreFeatures.PERMISSIONS_MANAGED_BY_UM\",\"jira.dashboard.statistics.service.statistics_searcher.vsearch\",\"com.atlassian.jira.config.CoreFeatures.ON_DEMAND\",\"com.atlassian.jira.ULTIMATE_SEARCH_FILTERS_ON\",\"connect.no-applinks\",\"jira.attachment.vertigo.SYNCHRONOUS_UPLOAD\",\"fusion.dvcs.use_amq_to_invoke_sync.enabled\",\"jira.vertigo.big
2017-07-27 20:42:02.454 INFO - GET https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/<id>/<attachment> asString Request Duration: 424ms

{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This is likely due to problem authenticating to Media API.

h3.Workaround
Run as current user instead.

h3. Summary

User is mentioned twice in 2 similar emails when that user is assigned and mentioned in a transition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Reviewer field as User Picker
 # Create a screen with that field
 # Set that screen as the transition screen for a transition
 # Add Post function to assign Assignee with the user in Reviewer field
 # Create an issue
 # Transition the issue in which the same user is set to Reviewer and mentioned in the comment area

h3. Expected Results

The user is only mentioned once
h3. Actual Results

The user is mentioned in 2 emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* On Safari 9, the project sidebar does not load properly and is unusable
* Software and business projects are affected
* Safari 10 renders the project navigation bar without issues

||Safari 9||Safari 10||
|!Safari9.png|thumbnail!|!Safari10.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1141.0
* Safari 8 and 9
* Mac OSX El Capitan

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to any issue

h3. Expected Results
* Project navigation bar should load(see table in Summary - "Safari 10")

h3. Actual Results
* Project navigation bar does not load(see table in Summary - "Safari 9")

h3. Notes
* Affects Safari 8
* Possibly affects older versions of Safari, but this theory is untested

h3.Workaround
* Use another browser
* Upgrade to Safari 10
fields.summary: Safari 9 does not load the project navigation sidebar

fields.description:
Currently, the 'Recent issues' list in JIRA is populated by issues that the user has clicked on or viewed within JIRA. Many add-ons and third-party integration allow you to meaningfully interact with issues _outside_ of the JIRA experience. An API that allows an add-on to 'touch' an issue, adding it to the 'Recent issues' list, would allow the user to more easily navigate to issues that they have been recently working on.

This would also enhance JQL results from queries using the *issueHistory()* JQL function, which is also very handy for building issue pickers in third-party integrations.
fields.summary: API to add issue to 'Recent issues' list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Backup creation fails as soon as the export is started

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Backup Manager
# Create backup for Cloud/Server

h3. Expected Results
Backup is created

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Export error
Passed List had more than one value.
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 1501102023714
{noformat}
 
Application logs:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.ExportException: BackupManager ran into a problem while preparing the database for export at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.preFlightChanges(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:239) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.export(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:165) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.lambda$performExportWrapped$2(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:136) at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.performExport(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:119) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.lambda$runTask$0(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:114) at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:134) at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:97) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:59) at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Passed List had more than one value. at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityUtil.getOnly(EntityUtil.java:68) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.ensureGroupHasGlobalPermission(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:334) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.preFlightChanges(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:258) ... 16 more
{code}

h3.Workaround
It is caused by duplicate 'system-administrators' group in Application Access Configurations for 'Jira administration' section  (<URL>/admin/accessconfig).
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 
* Reject the pending request to remove the duplicate entry
** It takes time for JIRA to sync with User Management. You can add/remove a user from a group to get immediate sync.
fields.summary: Backup creation fails due to duplicate entry in Global Permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Importing an instance that has a customer without an Atlassian Account, like the Portal only Customers, it fails with the following error:
{noformat}Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper$1: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-26 at 15.49.21.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take any instance with a Portal Only users (without an Atlassian Account)
# Perform an import

h3. Expected Results
* Be able to migrate content successfully

h3. Actual Results
* Import Fails with the following error:
{noformat}Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper$1: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* No workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing a CSV file, if we clone a ticket (any other unrelated ticket), JIRA 'mistakes' the CSV import task to the clone task and shows in UI that the CSV file finished successfully, though it continues to run in the background.

The ‘clone’ operation fails with an NPE (below). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a CSV import with enough entries to take some time
# While the CSV is importing, take any existing ticket in the system and clone it

# CSV import continues correctly
# Clone operation works

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) [?:1.8.0_77]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) [?:1.8.0_77]
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61) [tomcat-util.jar:8.0.36]
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.8.0_77]

{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This is probably related or the same problem as these other two bugs:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66938
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66949

This seems to occur because JIRA mistakes one task with the other.

h3.Workaround
The CSV task will continue and finish and, in spite of the NPE, the Clone seems to work, so the operations are successful either way.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue during a CSV import causes CSV to run only in background and NPE

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update - July 13, 2021}
Thank you everyone for your patience in waiting for this ticket to be resolved. We wanted to share an update that our Engineering teams have taken note of the number of customers impacted by this ticket and we are working on a plan to drive it toward resolution. Our goal is to inform administrators when an email address is put onto the suppression list, and then ultimately provide a way to remove them from the list. This improvement will take a coordinated effort across a number of back end and front end teams, and so we are unable to provide an exact timeframe for when the improvements will be in place at this stage, but we'll ensure we keep this ticket updated with any news.


For now, we are also shifting this issue over to become a suggestion, as while the experience of dropping emails is far from ideal, it is intended behaviour for email addresses to go onto the suppression list if they aren't responding, so that we can assure delivery for other emails. We are making this change for internal workflow reasons, but it does not change the priority that we are applying to resolving this ticket.


Kind Regards,
Matt Hunter
_Senior Manager, Cloud Service Enablement_
{panel}
h3.  
h3. Summary

For whatever reason that a JIRA notification email bounces back to Atlassian Cloud's mail server, the recipient's email address will be blocked in the system. At this state, no further notification emails can be sent out to the blocked email address. Furthermore, there are no indications in JIRA cloud that an email address is in this state.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Send out an email notification to an email address with a full mailbox.

h3. Expected Results
 - An error message should be indicated somewhere that the email bounced back and that the email address is blocked. There should be a threshold for bounces before adding the email address into the drop list.

h3. Actual Results
 - The email address will be blocked in the mail server and the JIRA users has no indication that the email address is in this current state.

h3. Notes

Atlassian Support can trace these notification emails and unblock the email addresses but there are no indicators in JIRA that can warn users of the current state of the email address. The email address will remain in this state until they reach out to Atlassian support to troubleshoot missing notification emails.
h3. Workaround

Please contact Atlassian Support to check if the missing notification emails is related to this issue.
fields.summary: Email notification stops working without any error indication

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The generated backup file in JIRA doesn't contain timestamp anymore. Instead it shows "Download backup file" and the zip file doesn't have timestamp as well.
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Navigate to *Backup Manager*
 # Create backup for Server or Cloud
 # The download link for the backup file generated is "Download backup file"
 # The backup file doesn't have timestamp anymore.

h2. Expected Result

It should show the timestamp with the format: jira_export_timestamp.zip
h2. Current Result

Currently, the backup file is: jira-export.zip
h2. Workaround
 # Right click on the download link
 # Click *Copy Link Address*
 # Paste the link somewhere, and it should be something like the following:

{noformat}
https://INSTANCE_NAME/plugins/servlet/export/download/a37f7b43-2f7d-4f14-8aa2-e92fd3c05e2f/jira-export5445738830559148795.zip{noformat}

 # At the end of the link, there is an EPOCH timestamp. In this case, copy "5445738830559148795".
 # Go to an EPOCH converter (such as [https://www.epochconverter.com/])
 # Paste the epoch timestamp to convert it to human readable data.
fields.summary: Timestamp is not appended to the backup file in JIRA

fields.description: Our team recently switched from Scrum to Kanban and things are going really well.  A lot of the research we did directed us to continue using story points for estimating the level of effort on our stories.  We've been doing this and the plan was to measure the team's performance based on how many points they "complete" each week.  I understand complete can be defined different ways, but essentially we're looking for those issues that were moved through our workflow during a specific date range so we can total up the points.  This has proven to be really difficult through JQL, so it would be great if there was an option through the Kanban reporting to see this information.
fields.summary: Measuring Performance in Kanban Through Story Points

fields.description:
h4. Summary

At the AWS structure, the JSON Export option is not available. It was possible to enable this at the bundled Add-ons, but after our infrastructure changes, the option to enable the add-on is unavailable as we can see on the following screenshots:

!jim_plugin.png|thumbnail!

!jim_1.png|thumbnail!

!jim_2.png|thumbnail!
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # List Any JQL
 # Try to export to JSON - Not available.

h4. Expected Result
 * The possibility to export to JSON

h4. Actual Result

*jira-importers-plugin* also called *jim-plugin* is a bundled system add-on that has some modules disabled by default. It was possible to enable them in the past, providing the ability to export and import issues using JSON.
fields.summary: Restore JSON Export option
